item.title: Actual Human Mistakes
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Hey Pyro, I tried this new procedure you made and for some reason, it ptinted this out in my srl autotalker…

buyiong yews 200 ea buyinmg yews 200 eabuyinmg yews 200 ea buiing yews 200 eabuiing yews 200 eabuiing yews 200 ea

or something like that, and it kept saying the message twice. The script worked fine without the humantext procedure, but when i added that in there, i got that weird output. I’ll try to fix it, so it doesn’t do that, but this is one wierd error. I used it with TypeSend just like you said to use it with.

NVM: Sorry I think it’s on my end. I’ll figure it out. :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:6, topic:5254”]It doesn’t press backspace when it makes a mistake though.

Maybe make it so that sometimes it fixes its mistake and other times it just sends it. :)[/quote]

Thats what I meant by Spky’s SendMyText. It’s made so it doesn’t fix the error, because most Runescape players do not go back, and fix the error they made.

item.title: Actual Human Mistakes
item.dc:creator: @Pyro Pyro
item.description:
@Pyro wrote:

NOTE: since we dont have a useful functions thing for just things we made and liked and wanted to share i just put it here.

Well i saw this a while ago. Much like the one in squig but better since its much shorter. Works well you can change the random if you like. Note it is only returning the string right now. Just use typesend in conjunction with it if you like. Even symbols seem to work so have fun

Function HumanText(Text:string):string; var Keyboard:array [1..8] of string;//Declares All vars Tempi,i,l,NewKey:integer; Temps,Newtext:string; begin keyboard[1]:='1234567890';//Loads your keyboard into all the arrays. keyboard[2]:='qwertyuiop'; keyboard[3]:='asdfghjkl;'; keyboard[4]:='zxcvbnm,./'; keyboard[5]:='!@#$%^&*()'; keyboard[6]:='QWERTYUIOP'; keyboard[7]:='ASDFGHJKL:'; keyboard[8]:='ZXCVBNM<>?'; for l:=1 to length(Text) do//This is like a repeat. But everyloop it automatically adds to I begin Temps:=copy(Text,l,1)//Just copys a letter in the string into a temporary string var if(random(10)=0)then //The randomise of the mistake. So higher it will make LESS mistakes. begin for i:=1 to 8 do begin Tempi:=pos(Temps,keyboard[i]) //Loads the POSITION of the letter in the ARRAY if(tempi<>0)then begin if(Tempi=1)then NewKey:=2//If the position in the array is 1 for example Q it cant move to left so it makes sure it goes to right if(Tempi=10)then Newkey:=9//Makes sure if pos is 10 it moves to left if(Tempi<>1) and (Tempi<>10)then Newkey:=Tempi+random(2)-Random(2)//The random moving bit NewText:=copy(keyboard[i],NewKey,1)//Now it puts the NEW letter into the string break; end; end; end else Newtext:=Temps//IF the random thing didnt equal 0 then it just keeps the letter the same result:=result+Newtext;//Just keeps adding letter bit by bit to the result. end; end;

Read full topic
